title: Ticket #5156: Implement MAX_TIME_PER_SCHEDD for negotiator
description:
In CMS, we're observing that a single schedd has the ability to completely ruin an entire negotiation cycle.

Some of our schedds have 400 submitter ads; when they get overloaded, the negotiator hits a 10s timeout for each submitter. Since we're on a glidein-based infrastructure, we must keep a limit on our total negotiation cycle time (preferably, no more than 15 minutes) - meaning a single bad schedd can basically stop all negotiation activity.
remarks:
2015-Jul-28 14:16:40 by bbockelm:
Testing this out in CMS-land, it appears to work fine. Certainly the log lines are much appreciated.

Only complaint is that integers are too coarse-grained for this (lots of negotiation interactions take ~0.4s, which are then rounded down to 0). This complaint is true for all the MAX_TIME_PER_* knobs so I think we can merge without addressing that if you'd like.

2015-Jul-28 16:12:50 by jfrey:
Some of the time, the interaction should cross a second boundary and be rounded up to 1 second. Across many interactions, I would expect it to even out statistically.

But as you say, that can be treated as a separate issue that affects all of the timing measurements in the negotiator.

2015-Aug-04 21:16:30 by bbockelm:
Hi Jaime,

Is this OK to merge to master? Its been working well for CMS for about a week.

Brian
